00113    /*
00114    * Default constructor
00115    */
00116    template <class Symmetry>
00117    SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::SymmetryGroup()
00118    {
00119       identity_ = Symmetry::identity();
00120       elements_.push_back(identity_);
00121    }
00122 
00123    /*
00124    * Copy constructor
00125    */
00126    template <class Symmetry>
00127    SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::SymmetryGroup(const SymmetryGroup& other)
00128    {
00129       identity_ = other.identity();
00130       for (int i = 0; i < other.size(); ++i) {
00131          elements_.push_back(other.elements_[i]);
00132       }
00133    }
00134

00136    * Destructor

00138    template <class Symmetry>
00139    SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::~SymmetryGroup()

00142    /*
00143    * Assignment operator.
00144    */
00145    template <class Symmetry>
00146    SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>& 
00147    SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::operator = (const SymmetryGroup& other)
00148    {
00149       if (this != &other) {
00150          identity_ = other.identity();
00151          elements_.clear();
00152          for (int i = 0; i < other.size(); ++i) {
00153             elements_.push_back(other.elements_[i]);
00154          }
00155       }
00156       return *this;
00157    }

00159    /*
00160    * Find an element in the group, return const pointer to its address.
00161    *
00162    * Return a null pointer if symmetry is not a member of the group.
00163    */
00164    template <class Symmetry>
00165    const Symmetry* SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::find(const Symmetry& symmetry) const
00166    {
00167       for (int i=0; i < size(); ++i) {
00168          if (symmetry == elements_[i]) {
00169             return &(elements_[i]);
00170          }
00171       }
00172       // Return null pointer if not found
00173       return 0;
00174    }
00175  
00176    /*
00177    * Add a new element to the group.
00178    */
00179    template <class Symmetry>
00180    bool SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::add(Symmetry& symmetry)
00181    {
00182       const Symmetry* ptr = find(symmetry);
00183       bool added; 
00184 
00185       if (ptr == 0) {
00186          elements_.push_back(symmetry);
00187          added = true;
00188       } else {
00189          added = false;
00190       }
00191       return added;
00192    }
00193 
00194    /*
00195    * Create a complete group.
00196    */
00197    template <class Symmetry>
00198    void SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::makeCompleteGroup()
00199    {
00200       Symmetry a, b, c;
00201       int      i, j, n;
00202       bool added, complete;
00203 
00204       // Add all inverses
00205       n = size();
00206       for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
00207          a = elements_[i].inverse();
00208          add(a);
00209       }
00210 
00211       // Add all products of existing elements, and their inverses
00212       complete = false;
00213       while (!complete) {
00214          complete = true;
00215          n = size();
00216          for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
00217             a = elements_[i];
00218             for (j = 0; j < n; ++j) {
00219                b = elements_[j];
00220                c = a*b;
00221                added = add(c);
00222                if (added) {
00223                   complete = false;
00224                }
00225                b = c.inverse(); 
00226                added = add(b);
00227                if (added) { 
00228                   complete = false;
00229                }
00230             } 
00231          } 
00232       } 
00233 
00234    }
00235 
00236 
00237    /*
00238    * Check validity of this group.
00239    */
00240    template <class Symmetry>
00241    bool SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::isValid() const
00242    {
00243       Symmetry a, b, c;
00244       int      i, j, n;
00245  
00246       // Check for inclusion of identity element
00247       c = Symmetry::identity();
00248       if (find(c) == 0) {
00249          UTIL_THROW("Identity element is not in group");
00250       }
00251 
00252       // Check inverses, uniqueness, and completeness
00253       n = size();
00254       for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
00255          a = elements_[i];
00256          c = a.inverse();
00257          if (find(c) == 0) {
00258             UTIL_THROW("Inverse of element not in group");
00259          }
00260          for (j = 0; j < n; ++j) {
00261             b = elements_[j];
00262             if (i != j) {
00263                if (a == b) {
00264                   UTIL_THROW("An element of the group is not unique");
00265                }
00266             }
00267             c = a*b;
00268             if (find(c) == 0) {
00269                UTIL_THROW("Product of two element is not in group");
00270             }
00271          }
00272       }
00273 
00274       // If no Exceptions have been thrown, return true
00275       return true; 
00276 
00277    }

00279    /*
00280    * Return the current size of the group.
00281    */
00282    template <class Symmetry>
00283    inline int SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::size() const
00284    {  return elements_.size(); }

00287    * Return identity element.
00288    */
00289    template <class Symmetry>
00290    inline const Symmetry& SymmetryGroup<Symmetry>::identity() const
00291    {  return identity_; }
